intro: Commersonia fraseri, commonly known as the Fraser's commersonia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and showy white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Commersonia fraseri is often found in heathlands and is an important component of the local flora.
